respStmt.note: Catalogued and encoded in July 2003 for the Manuscripts of the West Midlands project. Original XML description
Conversion of the original encoding to conform with TEI P5 and the Bodleian ODD. Minor updates and corrections to the description.

msDesc.head: ‘The Vernon Manuscript’: poetry and prose in Middle English and Anglo-Norman, c. 1390-1400; England (West Midlands?)

summary.p: This manuscript, famously known as the Vernon manuscript, is an impressive book in every respect. Its imposing size equals the extent of its vernacular Middle English texts whilst its plentiful decoration and illumination serve to highlight its luxury status. An extensive collection of Middle English religious and didactic texts, the manuscript runs to over 350 items and has been termed a 'typical medieval one-volume library' by Görlach (1974, p. 102). The manuscript is thought to date from c. 1390.

msContents.textLang: Middle English, Anglo-Norman and Latin. Scribe 1: Scribal dialect: Worcestershire. Linguistic Atlas Grid Reference: 378 262, LP 7670 (McIntosh, Samuels and Benskin 1986, p. 250). Serjeantson places the scribe of the Index (Scribe 1) into 'South Shropshire-South Staffordshire' area (1937, p. 227) Scribe 2: Scribal dialect: Worcestershire. Linguistic Atlas Grid Reference: 389 270, LP 7630 (McIntosh, Samuels and Benskin 1986, p. 249).

msItem.note: Supplementary quire (quire 1), by scribe A: index to the volume and Ailred of Rievaulx.

msItem.title: Index
msItem.rubric: Here bygynnen þe tytles off the book þat is cald in latyn tonge salus anime and in englyhs tonge sowlehele'

msItem.author: Aelred of Rievaulx
msItem.title: De Institutione Inclusarum
msItem.rubric: Informacio alredi abbatis monasterii de rieualle ad sororem suam inclusam translata de latino in anglicum per thomam n.
msItem.incipit: Nou let heere here and vnderstonde ententyflyche myne wordes whateuere heo be þat haþ fursake þis worlde
msItem.explicit: to my savyour þat i abide and to my domesman þat i drede he wylle deuoytly preye for my mysdedes þat he and i mowe come to þat blisse þat i vnworþly haue spoken of quod nobis misericorditer concedat qui viuit et regnat in secula seculorum amen
msItem.note: F. iiiv (top) printed as frontispiece in Ayto and Barratt 1984.
‘Part 1’, quires 2-14: South English Legendary and related texts.

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Old Testament History (Life of Christ)
msItem.incipit: ...hit comeþ in my þouht þe muchele sor and sunne
msItem.explicit: And so vr lord euere among nymeþ wreche of his soon
msItem.note: The beginning of this text is lost (initial only) due to the top inner corner of the leaf having been torn away.

msItem.title: Sayings of the Prophets
msItem.incipit: Al þat þe prophetes tolden whylen in heore prophecie
msItem.explicit: And alle þis oþere goode men and þe holy zakarie
msItem.note: Used as a headlink to the prologue of the Founding of the Feast of the Conception.

msItem.title: Prologue to the Founding of the Feast of the Conception
msItem.incipit: Wolle ȝe witen whanne and hou þe fest schal ben iholde
msItem.explicit: þat hit ne for leete

msItem.title: The Founding of the Feast of the Conception
msItem.incipit: Now we beoþ in þe storie so fer icome wiþinne
msItem.explicit: He loked hir as his ladie deore and what heo wolde hit was ido

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Prologue/Banna Sanctorum
msItem.incipit: Now bloweþ þis newe fruyt þat late began to springe
msItem.explicit: And fro on to oþur so arowe þe while þe ȝer wol leste

msItem.title: South English Legendary: New Year's Day
msItem.incipit: ȝeres day þe holy feste heiȝ day is and good
msItem.explicit: þe day is good to holde heiȝe of men þat beþ wyse

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Epiphany
msItem.incipit: Twelfþe dai þe heȝe feste nobliche is to holde
msItem.explicit: Wel ouhte we halewe þat ilke day and honoure also

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Hilary
msItem.incipit: Seint hillare þe holi mon of aquitayne was
msItem.explicit: Nou god for þe loue of hym vs bringe þider vchon. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Lives of St. Wulstan
msItem.incipit: Seint wolston bisschop of wircestre was her of engelonde
msItem.explicit: Nou god seene þat we mote wiþ him in þe ioye of heuene beo. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Lives of St. Fabian and St. Sebastian
msItem.incipit: Seint ffabian þrettene ȝer pope was in roome
msItem.explicit: And to þe ioye of heuene from pyne he gon wende

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Agnes
msItem.incipit: Seint agnes þe holy mayde wel sone heo bygon
msItem.explicit: And wende to þe blisse of heuene afture hire muchele pyne

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Vincent
msItem.incipit: Seint vincent in spayne was and to a cristene bisschop com
msItem.explicit: þat we mote to heuene come and forȝif vs vre misdede. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Julian Hosteler
msItem.incipit: Seint iulian goode herbigour of noble kuynde com
msItem.explicit: þat vr lord vs lete vr sunne bete and heuene haue to mede. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Blase
msItem.incipit: Seint blase wel clene lyf ladde wiþouten hore
msItem.explicit: þat seint blase is inne ibrouȝt and þat we þerof ne misse. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Agatha
msItem.incipit: Seint agace þat gode maide in cisyle was ibore
msItem.explicit: þat we to þe ioye of heuene wiþ hire come mote. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Scholastica
msItem.incipit: Seint scolace þat holy mayde holy was of lyue
msItem.explicit: Iburied at vr endyng day and to heuene flee. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Valentine
msItem.incipit: Seint valentin þe martir good mon was inouh
msItem.explicit: Now god for þe loue of hym vs bringe to þat ilke place. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Juliana
msItem.incipit: Seint iuliane com of heiȝe men as we fyndeþ iwrite
msItem.explicit: Didde for vs þat we mote to þe ioye of heuene weende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Matthias
msItem.incipit: Seint mathi apostel is as ȝe schule alle iwite
msItem.explicit: þat we whenne we henne wende come to heuene blisse. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Gregory
msItem.incipit: Seint gregori þe confessour in cisyle was ibore
msItem.explicit: þat he bifore vr lord crist vr neode vndurstonde. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Longinus
msItem.incipit: Seint longius was a blind kniht þo God was don on þe roode
msItem.explicit: Fforȝif vs vre misdedes her and bring vs to heuene also. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Edward the Elder
msItem.incipit: Seint edward þe ȝonge martir was kyng of engelonde
msItem.explicit: To þe loue of heuene wiþ hem vs brynge þere. Amen amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Cuthbert
msItem.incipit: Seint cuthberd was ibore her in engelonde
msItem.explicit: þorwh þe bone of seint cuthbert come þulke ioye to. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Benedict
msItem.incipit: Seint benet ladde holy lyf þat was so holy mon
msItem.explicit: þat seint benet is inne in heuene þat we þerof ne misse. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Julian the Confessor
msItem.incipit: Seint iulian þe confessor ibore was at roome
msItem.explicit: þat we whonne we henne wende come to heuene blisse. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Bridget
msItem.incipit: Seint bride of wel heȝe men in to scotlonde com
msItem.explicit: þat god haþ iordeyned þat lasteþ wiþouten ende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Oswald the Bishop
msItem.incipit: Seint Oswold was ibore heere in engelonde
msItem.explicit: God lete vs to þe ioye come þer he is inne ibrouȝt. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Chad
msItem.incipit: Seint chadde þe gode mon was her of engelonde
msItem.explicit: Nou god for þe loue of seint chadde to þilke ioye vs bringe. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Mary of Egypt
msItem.incipit: Seinte marie egipcian in egipte was ibore
msItem.explicit: Nou god for þe loue of seint marie þider vs lete wende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Feast of the Annunciation
msItem.incipit: Seinte marie day in lente among oþur dayes gode
msItem.explicit: þat we mote come to þat ilke ioye þat he vs to brouhte amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Moveable Feasts/Septuagesima
msItem.incipit: Festes meble þe beþe icleped fyue in þe ȝere
msItem.explicit: Fforte leuen heore luþur sunnes þat heo wrouhten er

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Lent
msItem.incipit: Now beoþ þer þreo hondred dawes and sixti in þe ȝere
msItem.explicit: Bote heo beon wiþoute wraþþe oþur of dedly sinne

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Easter
msItem.incipit: þe holy feste of aster comeþe after lenton anon
msItem.explicit: þat he ȝaf to stronge deþe for vs vppon þe roode

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Ascension
msItem.incipit: þe fourtiþe day þer afturward þat he aros from deþe to lyue
msItem.explicit: Let vs vr sunnes bete her þe fend to ouercome. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: The Southern Passion
msItem.incipit: Bifore six dayes of aster as a palmsone eue
msItem.explicit: þat me stele hit not awey þat þey mihte vndurȝite

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Resurrection
msItem.incipit: In þe dawynge þe soneday as þe day gon springe
msItem.explicit: And as mylde beo to sinfol men and ensaumple þerof toke
msItem.note: First part of the Southern Passion.

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Appearance to Mary Magdalene
msItem.incipit: Marie magdalene erliche was iwent
msItem.explicit: And wende euere þat vr lord weore awey ibore

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Mary Magdalene
msItem.incipit: Marie wolde noȝt awey er heo wuste more
msItem.explicit: Ffor as prest he is to forȝiue as mon is forte bidde

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Appearance on the road to Emmaus
msItem.incipit: Off vr lordes diciples þulke selue day tweye
msItem.explicit: So wite hem from drede of þe gywes bote seint thomas one

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Feria iiia in ebdomada Pasche
msItem.incipit: As late þulke selue dai in þe euenynge atte laste
msItem.explicit: And hose sunnes ȝe wiþ holdeþ wiþholde þer worþe also

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Appearance to Thomas
msItem.incipit: Thomas on of þe twelue þat his to nome was
msItem.explicit: And to alle þat goode beoþ to þe more blisse atte fyne

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Appearance by the Sea of Tybre
msItem.incipit: Bi þe see of tybre ihesus more schewede him to his fere
msItem.explicit: Ne hou longe after aster day at þo þei hedde iȝete

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Charge to Peter
msItem.incipit: To seint peter ihesus seide peter louest þou me
msItem.explicit: More aunguissche aȝen his deþ and þo þis wordes were ised

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Concerning Peter and John
msItem.incipit: To seinte peter ihesus sede folwe me anon
msItem.explicit: Ffor bettere is dye in good deþ þen beo euere her in wo

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Appearance at Mt. Tabor
msItem.incipit: Elleuene diciples to galile hom wende
msItem.explicit: Vr lord kudde more his loue as i ow telle may

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Choosing of Matthias
msItem.incipit: As þe enleuen disciples adoun isete were
msItem.explicit: Ffor þe mony ffestes of halewen þat bi faleþ in holy churche

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Ascension
msItem.incipit: After þat swete ihesus þe wey to heuene nom
msItem.explicit: By þe haly gost hem weore isent þei ne dorste out gon

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Pentecost
msItem.incipit: At vnderne a Witsoneday as þe apostles stode & sete
msItem.explicit: Bring vs to þe ioye of heuene þat þou vs bouhtest to. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Alphege
msItem.incipit: Seint alphe þe martir good mon was inouh
msItem.explicit: þat we mowe þorwh his preyere into heuene wende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. George
msItem.incipit: Seint george þe holi mon as we fyndeþ iwrite
msItem.explicit: Now god for seynt george loue vs leeue þider wende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Mark the Evangelist
msItem.incipit: Seint mark þe godspellere wyde wede aboute in londe
msItem.explicit: And for þe loue of seint mark graunt vs þider to wende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Peres
msItem.incipit: Seint peter þe frere prechour in þe cite of veronye
msItem.explicit: God vs bringe to þat ioye þat his soule to come. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Lives of Saints Philip and James
msItem.incipit: Seint phelip and seint iacob apostles weoren tweyne
msItem.explicit: þat vre soules mote wiþheoren in heuene ben ido. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Early History of the Cross
msItem.incipit: þe holy rode þe swete treo riht is to hauen in muynde
msItem.explicit: þat we mote to þe ioye of heuene come þat is so swete and god. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Quiriac
msItem.incipit: Seint quiriac þe bisshop prechede godus lawe
msItem.explicit: Bring vs to þe heiȝe ioye þat he vs bouȝte to

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Dunstan
msItem.incipit: Seint dunston was of engelonde icome of goode more
msItem.explicit: Bring vs to þe ioye of heuene as angelis þi soule bere. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Aldelm
msItem.incipit: Seint aldelm þe confessour was mon of goode lyue
msItem.explicit: þat we mote to þe ioye come þat he is inne ido. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Augustine
msItem.incipit: Seint augustin þat cristendom brouhte into engelonde
msItem.explicit: þat we mote to þe ioye come to whom vr lord vs bouhte. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Petronilla
msItem.incipit: Seint pernele þat holi mayde riht is to habben in muynde
msItem.explicit: Now god for þe loue of hire to þulke ioye vs bringe. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Barnabas
msItem.incipit: Seint barnabe þe apostel þat goode was and hende
msItem.explicit: Ffor loue of seint barnabe þat he to heuene vs bringe. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Eadburh
msItem.incipit: Seint adboruh þat holi maide was here of engelonde
msItem.explicit: þat we mote forþ wiþ hire to þe ioye of heuene wende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Alban
msItem.incipit: Seint albon þis holy mon was here of engelonde
msItem.explicit: þat we mote to þe ioye come þat euere schal ilaste. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Aylbriht
msItem.incipit: Seint aylbriht þe holy kyng kyng was of engelonde
msItem.explicit: þat his soule is to iwent aftur vr endynge. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Etheldreda
msItem.incipit: Seint aeldrede of heli god mayde was and hende
msItem.explicit: Nou god for þe loue of hire bring vs to heuene blis. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Botulf
msItem.incipit: Seint botulf þis holy monk and adulf his broþer
msItem.explicit: þat we mote to þat ioye come and so þe deueles schende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Patrick
msItem.incipit: Seint patrik com þorwh god to preche in irelonde
msItem.explicit: So þat we in purgatorie bileuen a luytel stounde. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. John the Baptist
msItem.incipit: Seint iohan was þe beste bern þe holy baptyst
msItem.explicit: Let vs þorwh vr cristendom to þe ioye of heuene come amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Peter
msItem.incipit: Seint peter was wiþe vr lord of alle hise apostles hext
msItem.explicit: þerfore ne reccheþ þis goode mon þauh me him do wo

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Paul
msItem.incipit: Aȝeyn þe prikke to wince swiþe strong is þe
msItem.explicit: Bring vs to þe ioye of heuene aftur þat we ben ded. Amen amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Athelwold
msItem.incipit: Seint aþelwold bisschop was and in engelonde ibore
msItem.explicit: Ffor þe loue of seint aþelwold to þe ioye of heuene vs bringe. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Swithun
msItem.incipit: Seint swithyan þe confessour was her of engelonde
msItem.explicit: Bring vs to þe ioye of heuene þorwh vr lordes sonde. Amen
msItem.note: The index gives St. Oswald here.

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Kenelm
msItem.incipit: Seint kenelm in engelonde was icome of goode streone
msItem.explicit: Ihesus for þe loue of him vs schilde from helle pyne. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Margaret
msItem.incipit: Seinte margarete was an holi maide and good
msItem.explicit: Nou god for þe loue of seinte margrete ne let vs neuer þerof misse. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Mary Magdalene
msItem.incipit: Seinte marie magdaleyn þat god forȝaf hire sunne
msItem.explicit: Bidde god þat we wiþ hire to þe ioye of heuene weende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Mildred
msItem.incipit: Seint mildride þe holi mayde of kynges kunne com
msItem.explicit: Nou god vs sende þulke wey þat we blenche not amis. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Christina
msItem.incipit: Seint cristine þis holi þing as i ow telle con
msItem.explicit: Nou god for þe loue of hire vs bringe þider vchon

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. James the Great
msItem.incipit: Seint iem þe holi apostel riht is to habben mone
msItem.explicit: Nou bidde we vr lord seint iem þat he us ȝiue milce and ore. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Alexius
msItem.incipit: Sitteþ stille withouten strif and i wol tellen ou of a lyf of an holy mon
msItem.explicit: Graunt vs alle god endyng and in heuene awonyng amen per charite

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Gregory
msItem.incipit: Alle þat ich in word and dede i þonke hit god al folkes kyng
msItem.explicit: þe pope haþ graunted hem to mede and h___ dawes to pardoun
msItem.note: The explicit has been purposely rubbed presumably to try to obliterate the reference to the Pope and his pardon relating to this text.

msItem.title: South English Legendary: The Seven Sleepers
msItem.incipit: Seue slepers were seli men as me haþ ou itold bifore
msItem.explicit: Bryng vs to þat ioye þat heore soules to wende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Dominic
msItem.incipit: Seint dominik þe noble frere in spayne was ibore
msItem.explicit: þat we beo forþwiþ him to þe ioye of heuene ibrouht. Amen amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Oswald the King
msItem.incipit: Seint oswold þe goode king of þat on ende of engelonde
msItem.explicit: þat vr lord vs sende his swete help and alle þat hebbeþ neode. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Christopher
msItem.incipit: Seint cristofre was a sarazin in þe lond of canaan
msItem.explicit: Now god vs bringe to þulke ioye þer he his soule brouhte. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Laurence
msItem.incipit: Seint laurence good mon was and in strong martirdom
msItem.explicit: Bring vs to þe ioye of heuene þat þin angelis his soule ladde. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Hippolytus
msItem.incipit: Seint ypolyt þe martir kniht was wiþ gret honour
msItem.explicit: þat god haue merci of vs alle and of alle þat habbeþ neode. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: The Assumption of Our Lady
msItem.incipit: Seinte marie godus moder fro þe apostles was heo nouht
msItem.explicit: Nou god vs graunte forþwiþ hire to þe ioye of heuene come. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Bartholomew
msItem.incipit: Seint bartholomeuȝ þe holi mon com of kynges blode
msItem.explicit: þat we þe sannores þorwh his bone come to heuene blis. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Giles
msItem.incipit: Seint gyles þe holi mon louede noþing sunne
msItem.explicit: þat we aftur þisse lyue to þe ioye of heuene wende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Ecgwin
msItem.incipit: Seint egwyne þe holy mon was here of engelonde
msItem.explicit: þat we mote to heuene come and forȝiue vs vre misdede. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Matthew
msItem.incipit: Seint matheu þe ewangelist apostel he was iwis
msItem.explicit: Ffor þe loue of seint marheu þat his holy soule is inne. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Legend of St. Michael
msItem.incipit: Seint michel þe archaungel and hise felawes also
msItem.explicit: þat þey þe brennynge of helle wiþ hem heo bereþ aboute
msItem.note: A three-part text with part three appearing at f. 291v, The Right Pit of Hell.

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Jerome
msItem.incipit: Seint ierome was swiþe god clerk and wis þorwh alle þinge
msItem.explicit: Nou god vs bringe to þulke ioye þat his soule gon to wende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Justina
msItem.incipit: Seint iustine of heiȝe men in antioche com
msItem.explicit: And for þe loue of seint ciprian schild vs from helle pyne. Amen
msItem.note: Includes the Life of St. Ciprian.

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Leger
msItem.incipit: Seint leger a bisschop was an holi mon also inouh
msItem.explicit: þat we aftur þisse lyue to þulke ioye mote wende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Francis
msItem.incipit: Seint fraunceis þe frere menour þat good mon was inouh
msItem.explicit: And as hit were men of witte þis foules he gonne preche
msItem.note: Eight leaves missing, ff. 57-64 with the loss of 11 texts.

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Clement
msItem.incipit: Allas quaþ þis gode mon myne leue children þreo
msItem.explicit: God ȝif vs part of þat ilke ioye þat his soule is inne. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Katherine of Alexandria
msItem.incipit: Seinte katerine of noble kunne com bi olde dawe
msItem.explicit: ȝif vs þe ioye of heuene and schild vs from helle pyne. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Andrew
msItem.incipit: Seint andreu þe apostel was seint petres broþur
msItem.explicit: And bidde for vs þat we mote come to heuene blisse. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Nicholas
msItem.incipit: Seint nicholas þe holi mon þat god confessor was
msItem.explicit: Schild vs from þe pyne of helle and dedlych sunne also. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Lucy
msItem.incipit: Seint lucie þe holi maide in cicile was ibore
msItem.explicit: Nou god for þe loue of hire vs lete alle þider wende. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Lives of Saints Martha and Frontoun
msItem.incipit: Seint Martha god womon was as ȝe schule here telle
msItem.explicit: Bring vs to þat heȝe blisse þer þin angeles hire soule bere. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Thomas the Apostle
msItem.incipit: Seint thomas þe gode apostel imartred was in inde
msItem.explicit: Bring vs to þe ioye of heuene to whom vr lord vs bouhte. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Stephen
msItem.incipit: Seint steuene was a gyeu and of gywes he com
msItem.explicit: Nou god for þe loue of him schilde vs from helle pyne. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. John
msItem.incipit: Seint ion þe ewangelist þat apostel also is
msItem.explicit: Dide for vs þat we mote come to heuene blis. Amen

msItem.title: South English Legendary: Life of St. Thomas of Canterbury
msItem.incipit: Wolle ȝe nou vnderstonde hou hit is write
msItem.explicit: Ac vr lord for seint thomas loue his grace sone of hem caste'
msItem.note: 121 lines missing at end. Ff. 81-88 lost with the loss of 11 texts.

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: St. Paula (IMEV 717.5)
msItem.incipit: Eiþer oþur þus to cloþun and fede
msItem.explicit: To godus sone þat is ihesus

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: St. Ambrose
msItem.incipit: Herkneþ sires for my purpose
msItem.explicit: Boþe more and eke lesse

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: 'De Theodosio Imperatore'
msItem.incipit: Hit bifel one tyme in ceyteyn
msItem.explicit: God ȝif us grace to beo not sore

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: A Maiden of Antioch
msItem.incipit: At antioche as men han sayde
msItem.explicit: And doy awey al vuel fame

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: Sithia and Climonen
msItem.incipit: Nou ȝer maidens alle and sum
msItem.explicit: þei toke heor corounes boye at ones

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: Sithia and Climonen
msItem.incipit: Sum tyme men reden þat þer was
msItem.explicit: On latyn take hede to his purpose

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: St. Theodora
msItem.incipit: At alisaundre telle i ow con
msItem.explicit: And ȝiue us heuene blisse. Amen

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: St. Bernard
msItem.incipit: Seint bernard born was at burgoyne
msItem.explicit: Of heuene riches blisse ȝeuen part. Amen

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: St. Augustine
msItem.incipit: Seint austin was nempned þat name
msItem.explicit: To preye for hym þat þis lyf made. Amen

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: St. Savinian and St. Savina
msItem.incipit: Sum tyme þer was an heþen man
msItem.explicit: Ffor þei sunten of hire hed

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: Barlaam and Josephat
msItem.incipit: A good mon þer was and a clene
msItem.explicit: Miracles is wrouht þorwh godus soon

msItem.title: Smaller Vernon Collection: St. Euphrosyne
msItem.incipit: In alisaundre þat grete citee
msItem.explicit: God graunte vs grace þat hit so be. Amen Amen for charite

msItem.note: ‘Part 2’, quires 15-22 (18-22 lost): La Estorie del Evangelie, Miracles of the Virgin, etc.

msItem.title: La Estorie del Evangelie
msItem.incipit: Sumwhile ich was wiþ sunne ibounde
msItem.explicit: As crist and lord of alle þinge
msItem.note: Text decorated with seven miniatures. Ff. 106-113 - formerly miniatures, all lost.

msItem.author: Richard Maidstone
msItem.title: Paraphrase of the 51st Psalm
msItem.incipit: so let me neuere werk biginne
msItem.explicit: He schylde vs alle from helle fere
msItem.note: Only a fragment of the text remains.

msItem.title: Prayer to the Trinity
msItem.rubric: Her biginneþ an orisun of þe trinite
msItem.incipit: Fadur and sone and holigost Lord to þe i crie and calle
msItem.explicit: On þe to seo þat swete siht ffadur and sone and holigost. Amen

msItem.title: Confession to Jesus Christ
msItem.rubric: A confession to ihesu crist
msItem.incipit: Swete ihesu crist to þe A gulti wrecche ich ȝelde me
msItem.explicit: Preyeþ for me to vre ladi þat ihesus of me haue merci

msItem.title: Prayer to the Five Wounds
msItem.rubric: A preyer to þe fiue woundes
msItem.incipit: Ihesu crist my lemmon swete þat diȝedest on þe rode tre
msItem.explicit: Beo hit me lef beo hit me loþ þow do hit a wey from me. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to Our Lady
msItem.rubric: A preiere to vre ladi
msItem.incipit: Marie modur and mayden euere wel þe be Modur and mayden mylde marie þenk on me
msItem.explicit: þat euermore schal lasten wiþouten eny misse. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer at the Elevation
msItem.rubric: A preyer at þe leuacioun
msItem.incipit: Welcome lord in fourme of bred In þe is boþe lyf and ded
msItem.explicit: Godus sone þat art so briht In fourme þou art of bred

msItem.title: Prayer at the Elevation
msItem.rubric: A preyer at þe leuacioun
msItem.incipit: I þe honoure wiþ al my miht In fourme of bred as i þe se
msItem.explicit: Wiþ ffadur and sone and holygost þat regneþ god in trinite. Amen

msItem.title: The Five Joys of Our Lady
msItem.rubric: þe fyue ioyes of vr ladi
msItem.incipit: Haue ioye marie modur and maide As þe angel gabriel message to þe saide
msItem.explicit: Graunt vs þe ioye þat is aboute þat neuer haþ endyng. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to God
msItem.rubric: An orisoun to god
msItem.incipit: Lord my god al merciable I þe biseche wiþ herte stable
msItem.explicit: þyne Ioyes vsen and wiþ þe wone In þi glorie wiþ ffadur and sone. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to Lord Jesus
msItem.rubric: An orisoun to vr lord ihesu
msItem.incipit: Lord swete ihesu crist haue merci of me þat out of heuene come into eorþ for me
msItem.explicit: On domesdai whon þo schalt demen schew us þi face freo And bring vs into paradys þer endeles blisse schal beo. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin
msItem.rubric: An orison to vr lady
msItem.incipit: Heil beo þou marie mylde qwen of heuene Blessed is þi nome and good hit is to nemene
msItem.explicit: Schild me from synne and schome þat I falle no mare And sen me hosul and schrift ar i heþene fare
msItem.note: According to the index, An orysoun to godes sone followed this text. It is now missing.

msItem.title: Prayer to God/Confession
msItem.rubric: A confession of wyrschip in orysoun
msItem.incipit: God þat al hast mad of nouht Ffor loue of mon þat þou hast bouht
msItem.explicit: And bring me to þi muchele blisse. Amen

msItem.title: A prayer to the Blessed Virgin Mary
msItem.incipit: Marie modur qwen of heuene þenk on me and here my steuene
msItem.explicit: Marie into blisse wiþ þe to wone Ffor ihesu loue þi deore sone. Amen

msItem.title: A prayer for the seven gifts of the Holy Ghost
msItem.incipit: God þat art of mihtes most þe seuen ȝiftus of þe holigost
msItem.explicit: To þat ioye þow me sende þat lasteþ now and ay. Amen

msItem.title: Confession for negligence of the Deeds of Mercy
msItem.incipit: Lord i ȝelde me gulti þat i neuere fedde þe hungri
msItem.explicit: þat I may comen aftur my ded And wonen euer lord wiþ þe. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer for Saving the Five Wits
msItem.incipit: Lord sunged haue i ofte In my fyue wittes wiþ wille and þouȝte
msItem.explicit: And also lord in synful felyng ȝif þi wille be. Amen

msItem.title: Confession of negligence of the Commandments
msItem.incipit: Inwardliche lord bi seche i þe Al my trespas forȝiue þou me
msItem.explicit: Fforȝif me now and alle men þat haue broken þi comaundemens ten

msItem.title: Hours of the Cross
msItem.incipit: Erliche in þe morwenyng ihesu þe iewes gunne take His frendes and his diciples hedden him sone forsake
msItem.explicit: God sende us lyues fode and in heuene a place. Amen

msItem.title: Veni creator spiritus
msItem.incipit: Cum lord vr makere holigost þe þouhtes of þyne forte sene
msItem.explicit: And sende us schrift for his pite þe ȝiftus of þe holygost. Amen

msItem.title: Song of Love to Jesus
msItem.incipit: Ihesu þi swetnesse whose miht hit se And þerof haue a clene knowyng
msItem.explicit: And led me lord in to þi blis Wiþ þe to wone wiþouten ende. Amen

msItem.title: A prayer to Jesus
msItem.incipit: Iesu þat art heuene kyng Sothfast god and mon also
msItem.explicit: Heere and spede my pore preyeres And saue me þat i ne beo spilt

msItem.title: Psalterium Beatae Mariae
msItem.rubric: Beatus virgin
msItem.incipit: Heyl mayden ouer maydenes vchon
msItem.explicit: Make me freo nou I þe prey Ffrom heui serwe to be. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to the Virgin
msItem.incipit: Mayden modur and comely qween þat art in heuene and euer schal ben
msItem.explicit: And schild vs from þe foule fend And let vs neuer be schent. Amen

msItem.title: A prayer to the five wounds of Jesus
msItem.incipit: Ihesus þat diȝedest vppon þe tre And þoledest deþ for loue of me
msItem.explicit: þat wiþouten ende schal leste And seo þi louely face. Amen

msItem.title: Prayer to the five joys of our Lady
msItem.incipit: Marie modur wel þe bee Modur and mayden þenk on me
msItem.explicit: And let me neuer for no synne fforgo þat ioye þat þou art inne. Amen par charite. Aue

msItem.title: Salutation to our Lady
msItem.incipit: Heil beo þow marie moodur and may Mylde and meke and merciable
msItem.explicit: þau synnes haue vs þorwh souht Bring vs to þi blis þat euer schal be. Amen. Aue

msItem.title: Psalterium Beatae Mariae
msItem.incipit: Heil mayde cheef of alle þorw whom þe blessed mon
msItem.explicit: And wiþ preisyng on þe calle þou herest heore orisoun

msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin: The city of Croteye
msItem.incipit: Lordus ȝif ȝe wol lusten to me Of croteye þe noble cite
msItem.explicit: Nou ladi preye þi sone on hih To alle cristene he graunte merci. Amen
msItem.note: The miniature which begins this text is placed at the bottom of column b.

msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin: The child slain by the Jews
msItem.incipit: Wose loueþ wel vre ladi Heo wol quiten his wille wel whi
msItem.explicit: Now marie for þi muchele miht Help vs to heuene þat is so briht

msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin: The harlot's prayer
msItem.incipit: God þat al þis world haþ wrouht And formed alle þing of nouht
msItem.explicit: Of hol remission of vre synne And to ioye þat heo woneþ inne. Amen

msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin: The boy in the oven
msItem.incipit: Lord makere of alle þing almihti god in maieste
msItem.explicit: In heuene an hih ihesu for þi moder loue. Amen

msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin: The man who cut off his foot
msItem.incipit: Iesu god and godus sone þat were a babe iboren Of þe mayden swete marie kuynde qween icoren
msItem.explicit: Help vs þat we mowe wiþ þe ffor euere in ioye dwelle

msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin: The Virgin a Surety
msItem.incipit: At constantynnoble in þat cite Dwelled a merchaunt of herte fre
msItem.explicit: And þat hit mote so be Seiþ alle amen par charite. Amen

msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin: The Fornicating Priest
msItem.incipit: In bok we fynde as we rede Of a preest was wylde of dede
msItem.explicit: And þat hit mote so be Seyþ to hire an aue

msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin: The monk with the quinsy
msItem.incipit: A mon of gret deuociun Was sum tyme in religiun
msItem.explicit: Preye we heo preye hire sone ihesus þat euer he haue merci on vs þat to his blisse he take vs to þat is and schal ben euer mo. Amen

msItem.title: Miracles of the Virgin: The incontinent monk
msItem.incipit: A sexteyn was in an abbey Of þe ordre of monkes grey
msItem.explicit: Gret wonder þei hedden hem among Whi þe sexsteyn was so long
